clinical_study.brief_title: Tolerability, Safety and Efficacy of Sigh Breaths During NIMV in Motor Neuron Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Tolerability, Safety and Efficacy of Sigh During Non-invasive Mechanical Ventilation in Patients With Motor Neuron Disease- A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Non-invasive mechanical ventilation (NIMV) is the recommended standard of care as initial therapy for patients with motor neuron disease (MND) with deterioration of the respiratory function.
SIGH_01 study is aimed at investigating the tolerability, safety profile and efficacy of sigh breaths during non-invasive mechanical ventilation in patients with MND in comparison to the standard ventilation support protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in nocturnal oxygen desaturation index (ODI) assessed by transcutaneous nocturnal oximetric registration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the arterial blood PCo2 concentration assessed by arterial blood gas test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the arterial blood PO2 concentration assessed by arterial blood gas test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the arterial blood Ph assessed by arterial blood gas test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the forced vital capacity (FVC) assessed by spirometry test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in self-perceived quality of life(QoL) assessed by 5-item Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Assessment Questionnaire (ALSAQ-5). Score between 0 and 100 pts (higher score denotes worse QoL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in sleep quality assessed by Pittsburg Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire. Score between 0 to 21, where higher scores denote a worse sleep quality.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in sleep quality assessed by Numeric Rating Scale (NRS). Score between 0 to 10, where higher scores denote a worse sleep quality.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in nocturnal dyspnoea assessed by Numeric Rating Scale (NRS). Score between 0 to 10, where higher scores denote a worse nocturnal dyspnoea.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation will be performed before NIMV initiation and two months after

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to give informed consent
- MND diagnosis according to El-Escorial criteria
- Non-invasive ventilation indications in accordance with the international guidelines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to adhere to study visit schedule or lack of reliable caretaker
- Presence of dementia
- History of arrhythmia, heart failure or pneumothorax
